Yes, I can provide information on the financial aid and scholarship options available for study abroad programs at Rutgers University. Rutgers University offers several financial aid and scholarship options for students who want to participate in study abroad programs. These options include:

1. Federal and state financial aid: Federal financial aid, including Pell Grants, Stafford Loans, and PLUS Loans, can be used for study abroad programs. New Jersey state financial aid programs, such as the Tuition Aid Grant and the Educational Opportunity Fund, can also be used for study abroad. 2. Rutgers study abroad scholarships: Rutgers offers several study abroad scholarships, including the Global Experience Scholarship, the Study Abroad Need-Based Scholarship, and the International Public Service Award. These scholarships provide financial assistance to students who need help covering the costs of study abroad programs. 3. External scholarships: There are several external organizations that offer scholarships specifically for study abroad programs. Students can research and apply for these scholarships on their own. Some of the popular external scholarship options for study abroad include the Gilman Scholarship, the Fund for Education Abroad, and the Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship. 4. Work-study opportunities: Rutgers offers work-study opportunities for students who participate in study abroad programs. These opportunities provide students with a way to earn money while they are abroad, which can help offset the costs of the program. In summary, Rutgers University offers a variety of financial aid and scholarship options to help students pay for study abroad programs. These options include federal and state financial aid, Rutgers study abroad scholarships, external scholarships, and work-study opportunities. Students can find more information about these options on the Rutgers Global website.
